bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Hannah Whitman Heyde, 11 March 1891
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: Sunny & fine to-day—had a letter f'mfrom Jess, St. Louis, this mn'gmorning — She is well & seems to be getting along—is ab'tabout 5 now, & I have eaten my early supper—had a fine varied meal bro'tbrought to me, but selected only some stew'dstewed tomatoes (with onions & crust bread) and half cup coffee, & sent the rest back—am sitting here same as usual—hope & pray it is comfortable with you, sister dear—a poor English street-singing boy stops out in the street & sings "the flowers that bloom in the spring" while another boy (his brother I fancy) fiddles. $2 enclosed—God bless you Han—
